intro: Chamaenerion angustifolium var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate fireweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open areas like roadsides and meadows. Its ability to colonize barren ground makes it an important pioneer species in ecological succession.
